title: Fed’s Charles Evans Says U.S. Still on Path for ‘Solid’ 2.25% GDP This Year
text:
Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Charles Evans said Tuesday that Fed rate cuts were necessary to keep the economy on its current path, which remains generally healthy despite some key risks.

The U.S. economy should grow by around 2.25% this year, which is “a solid number, as it exceeds my view of the economy’s long-run potential growth rate,” Mr. Evans said in the text of a speech to be delivered in Frankfurt. Mr. Evans expects the jobless rate to stay at a level just under 4% and he sees inflation slowly moving up...
description: Chicago Fed president sees inflation slowly moving up to Fed’s 2% target over next several years.
